Abdominal.name: Ab Rollout
Abdominal.about: This exercise works the abs and lower back and is the proper version of an ab roller.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Abdominal.name: Ab Rollout on Knees
Abdominal.about: This exercise works the abs and lower back and is the proper version of an ab roller. This version is performed on your knees.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Abdominal.name: Abdominal 4 Point Drawing In
Abdominal.about: This is a simple but powerful exercise to strengthen the abs and the core, the muscles that support the spine.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: This exercise requires very little movement just the flexing, or drawing in, of your abdominal muscles.

Abdominal.name: Bent Knee Hip Raise
Abdominal.about: This is a good exercise core muscle development.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Abdominal.name: Cross Body Crunches
Abdominal.about: This version of the crunch works both the upper and lower portion of the abs.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Contract your abs as you twist during this exercise.

Abdominal.name: Crunches
Abdominal.about: This is the most common abdominal exercise and possibly the most often improperly performed. Here is how to perform it correctly.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Keep your hips straight and your lower back against the floor during this exercise.

Abdominal.name: Crunches with Legs on Stability Ball
Abdominal.about: This exercise uses a Stability Ball as the base during your crunches.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Take your time and perform this exercise in a slow controlled manner.

Abdominal.name: Decline Crunches
Abdominal.about: Using a decline crunch allows you keep your legs steady and isolate all of the abdominal muscles.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Use the full range of movement in this exercise for the optimal results.

Abdominal.name: Decline Oblique Crunches
Abdominal.about: This version of a decline crunch isolates the oblique (side) muscles of the abs.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Abdominal.name: Seated Cable Ab Crunches
Abdominal.about: This exercise uses the weight of a cable machine to assist in a abs crunch.
Abdominal.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Abdominal.tips: Perform this exercise in a slow controlled manner.

Back.name: Back Extension on Stability Ball
Back.about: TThis exercise provides flexibility as it strengthens the muscles of the back and core.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Back.name: Barbell Rear Delt Row
Back.about: A good workout that tergets your middle back and posterior deltoids.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Keep your head up and your back straight while doing this exercise.

Back.name: Barbell Shrugs
Back.about: This is an exercise for the traps.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Try to squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the shrug. Concentrait on doing this exercise slowly, people often try rush through it.

Back.name: Barbell Upright Rows
Back.about: The barbell upright row is a standard upright row exercise that targets your traps and deltoids.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Keeping your abs tight will help protect your back during the upright row.

Back.name: Bent Arm Pullover
Back.about: The bent arm pullover targets your chest using an arcing motion.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Keep your back flat against the bench at all times. Your feet should also stay firmly on the ground.

Back.name: Body Row
Back.about: This is a good overall all exercise for the chest, back and core muscles. You should use a Smith Machine or stable tall weight rack for this exercise.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Keep your back flat throughout this exercise.

Back.name: Climbers Chin Up
Back.about: This variation on the basic chin up is a great exercise for people who rock climb.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Alternate sides while performing this exercise. Allow your body to hang down completely.

Back.name: Close Grip Front Lat Pulldown
Back.about: This is a classic body builder exercise to build your lower Lats (back muscles).
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Keep your abs drawn in and do not swing your back during this exercise.

Back.name: Dumbbell Row
Back.about: This exercise works the abs and lower back and is the proper version of an ab roller.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Back.name: Machine Shrug
Back.about: The smith machine shrug is a safer alternative to barbell shrugs, especially if you are doing heavier weights.
Back.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Back.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Biceps.name: Alternate Bicep Curl
Biceps.about: This exercise is a single arm version of a biceps curl.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Do not swing your body as you perform this exercise.

Biceps.name: Alternate Hammer Curl
Biceps.about: This exercise uses a hammering (up and down) motion to isolate the biceps.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Do not turn your wrists during this exercise.

Biceps.name: Alternate Incline Curl
Biceps.about: This exercise uses an incline bench to change your bodys position as you perform bicep curls.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Biceps.name: Ball Wall Circles
Biceps.about: Ball Wall Circles will strengthen and stretch your rotator cuff while stretching your chest.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Stay far enough away from the wall so you can fully extend your arms. Do not lock your elbow though.

Biceps.name: Bicep Curl Lunge
Biceps.about: This exercise works the abs and lower back and is the proper version of an ab roller.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Use slow and steady movements with this exercies.

Biceps.name: Bicep Curl on Stability Ball
Biceps.about: This exercise incorporates balance along with a bicep curl.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Lower your arms and return to starting position and switch legs.

Biceps.name: Bicep Curl with Deadlift
Biceps.about: This is an advanced exercise. This exercise combines a bicep curl with a deadlift.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Performing this exercise in front of a mirror may help you spot and correct your form.

Biceps.name: Bicep Curls
Biceps.about: This version of a biceps curl uses both arms at the same time.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Do not swing your body as you perform this exercise.

Biceps.name: Concentration Curls
Biceps.about: Concentration exercises limit your range of movement to increase the effectiveness of the movement.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Keep all of your body still except the arm you are exercising..

Biceps.name: Drag Curl
Biceps.about: This exercise is credited to the late Vince Gironda, the Iron Guru. It not only blasts the biceps and works the forearms as well.
Biceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Biceps.tips: Do not move your elbows or shoulders during this exercise.

Chest.name: Bench Press
Chest.about: The mighty bench press is a great exercise for building a powerful chest.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Choose a weight that is challenging and allows you to maintain proper form. Improper form is less effective and could result in an injury. Use a slow controlled motion and never lock your elbows

Chest.name: Bench Press Machine
Chest.about: This is a primary exercise for the Pectorals (chest muscles). Many people prefer this exercise to the standard Bench Press because if offers more stability for people new to exercise.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Chest.name: Bench Press With Bands
Chest.about: The resistance comes from a slightly different angle so will target a different area of your pectorals.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Don't lock your elbows at the top of this exercise.

Chest.name: Butterfly Machine
Chest.about: The butterfly machine is a simple way to target your chest. This is a machine exercise, so it's very easy to do.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Focus on using your chest for this exercise. You should be squeezing from the inner part of your chest, not pushing with your biceps or shoulders.

Chest.name: Cable Crossover
Chest.about: The cable crossover is a good exercise for targeting your inner chest.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: When your arms are in front of you, contract your pectorals for a moment to make this exercise even more effective.

Chest.name: Chest Dips
Chest.about: The chest dip is a variation of the tricep dip that focuses more on your chest. Even though it uses a dip machine, it is a body weight only exercise.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Try not to lock your elbows in the starting position.

Chest.name: Decline Bench Press
Chest.about: The decline bench press is a variation of the bench press performed on a incline bench. It targets the lower part of your chest.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Concentrate on using your chest for this bench press. You should feel as it the lifting is coming from your elbows.

Chest.name: Decline Chest Press
Chest.about: This exercise works the abs and lower back and is the proper version of an ab roller.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Keep your shoulders and lower back against the bench at all times during this exercise.

Chest.name: Incline Flys
Chest.about: This is a sculpting exercise for the pectoral muscles (Chest).
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Keep your hips and shoulders on the bench at all times during this exercise.

Chest.name: Wide Grip Bench Press
Chest.about: This is an exercise for the Pectoral (Chest) muscles. It uses a wider grip that focuses on the outer portion of the chest.
Chest.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Chest.tips: Keep your abs drawn in and your back flat on the bench throughout this exercise.

Combined.name: Box Jumps
Combined.about: When training for explosive power, perform box jumps at a very challenging height for sets of 1â€“3 reps.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Combined.name: Jump Rope
Combined.about: The jump rope can be a great cardio exercise if you know how to jump rope properly
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Combined.name: Push Jerk
Combined.about: A Push Jerk is a progression of the push press in which a forceful hip drive coupled with a drop under the bar--a catch--is used to aid in getting the load overhead.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: According to CrossFit, you can typically lift 30% more we

Combined.name: One Arm Snatch
Combined.about: This is an advanced exercise that works most of the muscles of the body. Exercises like this are used to develop functional strength for sports that require strong hands.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: Bend your knees as you lift and lower the weight to help control the movement.

Combined.name: Snatch Pull
Combined.about: The snatch pull, performed correctly, can begin improving your physique in only two workouts.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.

Combined.name: Wall Balls
Combined.about: Done right, wall balls are a great all-around conditioning movement. Start with your feet shoulder-width apart, your shoulders pulled back and down, and a medicine ball held at chest height with your elbows under the ball.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Combined.name: Turkish Get-Upt
Combined.about: The exercise primarily works the core body and abdominals but engages multiple muscle groups in unison, as it calls into play the quads, calves and shoulders too.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.

Combined.name: Snatch
Combined.about: The Snatch is the world's fastest lift. In addition to moving the weight quickly, the snatch also moves the weight a long distance - from the ground all the way overhead.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: This is a very advanced exercise so be extremely careful with the weight used. Bad form on this exercise can lead to serious injury.

Combined.name: Power Clean
Combined.about: The power clean teaches explosion. It cannot be done slowly. And since it involves a longer pull than the squat clean, it emphasizes the finish, where the maximum hip, knee.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: This exercise is extremely complex and requires the execution of many phases.

Combined.name: One Arm Side Deadlift
Combined.about: This is an advanced exercise that works most of the muscles of the body. Exercises like this are used to develop functional strength for sports that require strong hands.
Combined.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Combined.tips: Perform this exercise with an empty bar to become familiar with the movement before adding weights.

Legs.name: Ankle Circles
Legs.about: This is the most simple of all exercises for the calves.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Reverse the direction (counter-clockwise) and switch feet.

Legs.name: Balance Board
Legs.about: Your calves are stabilizing muscles for your legs, so this exercises uses a Balance Board or wobble board to force you to balance.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Keep a slight bend in your knees to help you balance.

Legs.name: Barbell Lunges
Legs.about: This is a classic leg and lower body exercise with many variations this is the basic version.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Do not the pressure of your body on your knee during this exercise.

Legs.name: Barbell Step Ups
Legs.about: This exercise builds coordination as well as muscle.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Use a lighter weight until you are used to the motion of this exercise.

Legs.name: Bicep Curl Squat
Legs.about: This exercise combines a squat with a curl to effectively work the entire body. This is an advanced exercise.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Contract your biceps as you curl your arms up.

Legs.name: Bridge
Legs.about: A great exercise for beginners and experienced alike. Bridges along with Planks are simple yet effective tools for building and maintaining cores strength.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Lift up hips off the floor as you draw your abs in and keep your glutes tight.

Legs.name: Calf Raises with Bands
Legs.about: This exercise uses a band to create resistance.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Pause for a moment and then lower your heel to the floor.

Legs.name: Front Squat
Legs.about: The Front Squat is a Squat variation which has the barbell rest on your front shoulders unlike the Back Squat where the bar rests on your upper-back.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes.

Legs.name: Leg Extensions
Legs.about: This exercise is a staple for building strong legs.
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Use controlled movements for this exercise, do not swing the weight up.

Legs.name: Narrow Stance Leg Press
Legs.about: This is a variation of the leg press which targets more of the external muscles of the legs by moving your feet closer together
Legs.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Legs.tips: Do not lock your knees at the top.

Sholder.name: Arnold Press
Sholder.about: The Arnold Press is a variation of a standard military press that allows it to also target the rotator cuffs. It targets both your front and side deltoids.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Avoid the Arnold Press if you are experiencing shoulder pain. Beginners should try this exercise with light weight to master the correct form.

Sholder.name: Barbell Front Raises
Sholder.about: This exercise works your front shoulder muscles to improve all of your arm movement and help with everyday life. And you'll feel better with sculpted shoulders.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Be sure to hold your abs tight to support your back. Even though it's tempting, don't bend back to help you lift. Also, be careful not to lock your elbows.

Sholder.name: Bent Over Cable Lateral Raises
Sholder.about: The bent over cable lateral raise is a good exercise for targeting your rear deltoids. The cable machine offers a consistent resistance than a a dumbbell bent over raise.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Sholder.name: Bent Over Rear Delt Row
Sholder.about: The advantage of this exercise over a standard rear delt row is that you can use the bench to keep yourself stable and avoid back injuries.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Sholder.name: Cuban Press
Sholder.about: The Cuban Press targets the rotator cuff muscles of your shoulders.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: As with most rotator cuff exercises, you don't need to use a heavy weight with the cuban press.

Sholder.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raises
Sholder.about: Dumbbell lateral raises will help build strong shoulders and improve definition.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Try to feel as if you're leading with your elbows and keep your wrists lower than your elbows.

Sholder.name: Dumbbell Raise
Sholder.about: Dumbbell raises are a great way to target your shoulders
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Sholder.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
Sholder.about: The Dumbbell Shoulder press is a variation of the standard military press that puts more focus on the stabilizer muscles.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Make sure you don't lock your elbows in the top position of the shoulder press. Locking your elbows, especially when you're using heavier weights, can cause very serious injuries.

Sholder.name: Lying One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
Sholder.about: The Lying One Arm Rear Lateral Raise is an advanced exercise that will target your rear deltoids.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Sholder.name: Shoulder Press
Sholder.about: The press, overhead press or shoulder press is a weight training exercise in which a weight is pressed straight upwards from the shoulders until it is locked out overhead. The lift is performed standing.
Sholder.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Sholder.tips: Technique is very important in this lift. The tendency is to arch the low back during the upward phase, increasing the loading upon your spine.

Triceps.name: Barbell Incline Triceps Extension
Triceps.about: This version of a triceps extension uses gravity to increase the resistance of the exercise.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Triceps.name: Bench Dips
Triceps.about: This exercise is one of the most basic and still one of the best for building the triceps (muscles on the back of the arm).
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Do not go below a 90 degree angle as this can cause on your shoulders.

Triceps.name: Close Grip Smith Machine Bench Press
Triceps.about: This version of a Bench Press uses a close grip to isolate the triceps as well as working the chest.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Triceps.name: Close Triceps Push-Up
Triceps.about: This version of the Pushup isolates the tricep (back of the arm) muscles.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Triceps.name: Decline Close Grip Bench To Skull Crusher
Triceps.about: This exercise combines a close grip bench press with triceps extension.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Triceps.name: Incline Triceps Extensions
Triceps.about: This version of the triceps extension uses an incline bench.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Triceps.name: Incline Triceps Extensions
Triceps.about: This version of the triceps extension uses an incline bench.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Practice raising your hips and butt as high as you can with this exercise.

Triceps.name: Kneeling Triceps Extension
Triceps.about: Kneeling allows you to isolate your triceps more effectively.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Keep your abs drawn in and your back straight as you perform this exercise.

Triceps.name: Lying Triceps Extension
Triceps.about: This exercise uses gravity to increase the resistance of the weight.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Slowly raise the dumbbell back to the starting position.

Triceps.name: One Arm Tricep Cable Extensions
Triceps.about: This exercise isolates the triceps muscles individually.
Triceps.steps: Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out as much as you can handle so that your back is straight.Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise.Roll back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.
Triceps.tips: Keep your elbow close to your side while performing this exercise.
